intro: Cremanthodium lineare var. roseum, commonly known as the rose-colored cremanthodium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, pink to rose-colored flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
